snippet: The presidential candidate’s economic agenda is grounded in top research, but falls short of the challenge of helping “everyday Americans” get ahead.
abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column examines economic agenda laid out by Hillary Clinton to help revive stagnant wage growth and give middle-class Americans a leg up; holds that for all its virtues, plan falls short of necessary scale; argues that to be truly successful, Clinton will have to reshape entrenched political positions, and convince solid majorities of voters that government plays vital role in their lives.
lead_paragraph: The presidential candidate’s economic agenda is grounded in top research, but falls short of the challenge of helping “everyday Americans” get ahead.

headline.print_headline: A Proposal to Help Falls Short
headline.main: Sizing Up Hillary Clinton’s Plans to Help the Middle Class
